name: policy plan
body:
Main Policy Plan

1. Objectives and Activities

Activities: PySport focuses on promoting knowledge sharing and the development of open-source sports data analysis. We organize events, meetups, and workshops where professionals, students, and researchers exchange knowledge and best practices. Additionally, we support open-source projects and assist researchers in making their work accessible to a broader audience within sports data analysis.

Timing of Activities: Meetups and workshops are held regularly throughout the year, depending on demand and partner availability. So far, we have organized meetups in locations such as Eindhoven and London.

Annual Conference: Starting in 2026, we aim to hold an annual conference in Europe to unite and grow the PySport community. Support for open-source projects and funding for research is ongoing, depending on available resources.

Contribution to Objectives: These activities contribute to our objective by enhancing accessibility and development within sports data analysis and fostering knowledge sharing. Sports play a leading role in society, and by spearheading data analysis in the sports world, we can inspire and accelerate progress in other sectors. This not only drives innovation in sports but also in fields like healthcare, education, and technology, where data analysis plays an increasingly vital role.

2. Sources of Income

PySport obtains income from various sources:

Sponsorship: Companies and organizations can choose from a variety of sponsorship options to support PySportâ€™s activities. This ranges from financial support to the provision of resources for specific events.

Grants and Funds: We actively seek grants and funds for non-profits that align with our mission to promote open-source sports data analysis.

Donations: Donations from members of the PySport community and other stakeholders are welcomed to ensure the growth and continuity of our activities.

3. Financial Accountability

Expenditure of Income: Income is used to organize meetups, workshops, and conferences, covering costs such as venue rental, speakers, and materials.

Funding Open-Source Projects: PySport provides financial support to existing and new open-source projects that contribute to the sports data analysis sector.

Diversity and Inclusion Grants: A portion of the income is used to provide grants to projects that enhance diversity within sports data analysis.

Retained Funds: Any remaining funds are kept in a savings account to support future projects and activities. Investments are currently not considered.

Accountability and Reporting: At the end of each calendar year, PySport prepares a financial report detailing all income and expenditures. This report is presented to the board and made publicly available on our website.

4. Compensation Policy

Statutory Board and Policy-Making Body: The PySport board operates on a voluntary basis and does not receive compensation for their work. However, expenses may be reimbursed if they are pre-approved and related to PySport activities.

Personnel: Currently, PySport has no paid employees. In the future, external experts may be hired for specific projects, at market-based rates.

5. Activity Report

Completed Activities:

  • Meetup Eindhoven (2023): Presentations by experts in sports data analysis for an audience of sports clubs and data experts.
  • Meetup London (2024): Gathering of professionals in sports data analysis, with presentations and networking opportunities.
  • PyData Eindhoven (2024): Participation in a conference with PySport speakers on topics such as cycling performance, data infrastructure in football, and tennis.
